humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, the patient's pN stage is 'pN0 (sn)'. This indicates that there are no metastatic carcinomas in the sentinel lymph nodes (sn). Based on the rules provided, rule 2, modified rule 6, new rule 10, and new rule 11 state that N0 indicates no positive lymph nodes or no metastatic carcinoma in sentinel lymph nodes and regional lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pN 0 (sn)' component of the tumor classification in the pathology report indicates that there is no evidence of cancer in the sentinel lymph nodes (N0). The 'sn' notation refers to sentinel lymph node. This notation is used when the sentinel lymph node is the only lymph node removed and examined and it contains no cancer. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.
